Don't use "" in image-alt image-alt: | An AI generated image of a pencil sketch of a pile of packages. #categories: # - TAG_1 # - TAG_2 #twitter-card: # uncomment lines below for different title and description to post # title: | # description: | # uncomment for different image to post # image: | # image-alt: | # defaults to 500 x 500 summary: uncomment lines below for large card # image-width: 600 # image-height: 314 # card-style: "summary_large_image" draft: false --- ::: {.cell} ::: ` slides`{=html} ` materials`{=html} ## Overview In this talk, I will try to convince you that if you have any of your own data or write any of your own R functions, then you should put them into an R package. Benefits include reproducibility and keeping everything together and accessible. Also, it’s really easy to do, and to prove it, I will build a package from scratch before your very eyes. I will also introduce the `bookdown` package for writing reports and even your thesis. Filled with tips and tricks from my own experiences, this talk could save you hours! ## Event details **Event:** [Birmingham R User Group](https://www.meetup.com/BirminghamR/events/253456048/?gj=co2&rv=co2&_xtd=gatlbWFpbF9jbGlja9oAJGE0MGZmNDA5LTFlMjctNDFhNS04ODgzLTM4MGU2ZWViM2Y3OQ) **Date:** August 8th, 2018 **Time:** 18:00-20:00 GMT+1 **Location:** Faraday Wharf, Innovation Birmingham Campus, Holt Street, Birmingham Science Park, B7 4BB ## Key points - Put your data and functions in an R package - R packages are good for reproducibility, for keeping everything together and for sharing - Existing R packages such as {usethis}, {devtools} {roxygen2} and {testthat} take the friction out of writing your own packages ## Slides Keyboard shortcuts for slideshow (once you've clicked inside it): - Use ← and → to navigate through the slides. - Use o for an overview of all slides. - Use h to see a list of other shortcuts - f to toggle full screen not working, but the rest are fine. - For full screen slides, go to [slides]("https://ellakaye.github.io/BirminghamR-talk/PhD_to_package_birmR.html#1") then press f.
